body:
The problem is also present for `java.lang.Short` but not for its primitive type.
Using a primitive `float` will make the build fails with this stacktrace:
```
java.lang.RuntimeException: io.quarkus.builder.BuildException: Build failure: Build failed due to errors
        [error]: Build step io.quarkus.resteasy.reactive.jackson.deployment.processor.ResteasyReactiveJacksonProcessor#handleEndpointParams threw an exception: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: Index 0 out of bounds for length 0
        at org.objectweb.asm.Frame.merge(Frame.java:1280)
        at org.objectweb.asm.Frame.merge(Frame.java:1255)
        at org.objectweb.asm.MethodWriter.computeAllFrames(MethodWriter.java:1612)
        at org.objectweb.asm.MethodWriter.visitMaxs(MethodWriter.java:1548)
        at io.quarkus.gizmo.MethodCreatorImpl.write(MethodCreatorImpl.java:142)
        at io.quarkus.gizmo.ClassCreator.writeTo(ClassCreator.java:233)
        at io.quarkus.gizmo.ClassCreator.close(ClassCreator.java:257)
        at io.quarkus.resteasy.reactive.jackson.deployment.processor.JacksonCodeGenerator.create(JacksonCodeGenerator.java:89)
        at io.quarkus.resteasy.reactive.jackson.deployment.processor.JacksonCodeGenerator.create(JacksonCodeGenerator.java:68)
        at io.quarkus.resteasy.reactive.jackson.deployment.processor.ResteasyReactiveJacksonProcessor.handleEndpointParams(ResteasyReactiveJacksonProcessor.java:434)
```

Also using `Byte` or its primitive type prevents the generation of reflection-free (de)serializer.

Yeah I suspect that anything that is not a direct match here https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/main/extensions/resteasy-reactive/rest-jackson/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/resteasy/reactive/jackson/deployment/processor/JacksonDeserializerFactory.java#L470 requires some transformation.
I will have a look at this one.

issue.title: Reflection-free deserializers - Better handle basic types

body:
https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/47553 fixes both your case and the primitive case for me.

Feel free to test the PR and report back!
